author: Staff Reporter
text:
Alleging that the BJP was spreading communalism through the Ram temple issue, the Aam Aadmi Party on Saturday said the saffron party should not use universities for holding seminars on the subject.

It was speaking of a seminar that began in Delhi University on the issue. The party alleged that the move was aimed at the 2017 Assembly polls in Uttar Pradesh.

Terming it a “sensitive issue,” senior AAP leader Ashutosh said the case is pending before the Supreme Court and the decision on it should be come from the judiciary and not outside.

“There were riots in Muzaffarnagar before the Lok Sabha polls. Then there were communal riots in Delhi before the elections.. And before the U.P. polls, you (BJP) have brought up the Mandir issue again,” he said.

The Chhatra Yuva Sangharsh Samiti, the party's student wing, also protested against the seminar. The protesters were detained by the police and later let off.
title: BJP using varsities for communal agenda, says AAP
